description: The SportsJS schema contains properties common to all (or many) sports.

truncatedDateTime.description: The type of a calendar date with an optional time part which may be truncated from the second part to the month part.

gridType.description: A two dimentional grid coordinate representation in the form of a  number representing the x coordinate, a colon, then a number representing the y coordinate. The origin (0,0) and granularity may be determined by the  distributor.

location.description: The location considered as the home of the entity.

contactInfo.description: Wrapper for different renditions of contact information.

phone.description: A phone number, preferred in an international format.

fax.description: A fax number, preferred in an international format.

address.description: An address. Its use is refined by the object wrapping it.

lines.description: Lines of address information, in the format expected by a postal service. City, country area, country and postal code are expressed separately.

county.description: Name of a subdivision of the region.

region.description: Name of the region, state or province of a country

countryCode.description: An ISO two-letter or three-letter country-code.

position.description: The geospatial data of the location. Default Coordinate Reference Systems is WGS84

altitudeMetres.description: The altitude in metres above the zero elevation of the reference system (sea level).

altitudeFeet.description: The altitude in feet above the zero elevation of the reference system (sea level).

name.description: Name of the entity, could be a player, official, associate, team, etc. Sometimes a person is referred-to by different names, depending upon the language in which the document is displayed.

salutation.description: Any salutation used with the name.

given.description: The first name refered to. For people, should be the given name. Also, if person has only one name, like Pele or Ronaldo, use this one.

family.description: The family last name referred to. For people, should be the surname.

nickname.description: A nickname ascribed to the person or team.

alternate.description: Alternative version of a name, this may be an alias.

abbreviation.description: An abbreviation, usually used for teams in display locations where space is constrained.

sportsContent.description: Metadata and coverage of sporting news. | Good for scores, schedules, standings, statistics, etc.

eventMetadata.description: Background information about a game. | Where, when, and what an event is.

eventStats.description: Stats applying to the game as a whole. Initially designed for motor-racing, but potentially applicable to many sports.

eventAction.description: Complex type for sports events, both generic and sport specific.

action.description: Any number of action inside the actions holder.

tournamentMetadata.description: Background data about a tournament. | Where and when the this tournament took place.

tournamentDivisionMetadata.description: General information about the division of this tournament. | Where and when this division is competing.

tournamentPartMetadata.description: General information about the division of this tournament. | Where and when this division is competing.

type.description: The phase of the tournament: semi-final, quarter-final, etc. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/sptournamentphase/

formatType.description: The format type of tournament or tournament phase: group, elimination, etc. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/sptournamentform/

title.description: A short natural language name for the catalog.

catalogRef.description: A reference to a remote catalog. A hyperlink to a set of scheme alias declarations.

href.description: A hyperlink to a remote Catalog.

catalog.description: A reference to the document listing externally-supplied controlled vocabularies. | The catalog file can be in NewsML 1

advisory.description: A short textual message to editors receiving the document. | Not generally published through to end-users.

featureName.description: A displayable name for the resource identified by the fixture-key.

sportsMetadata.description: Generic metadata object for many SportsJS elements.

catalog.description: A reference to the document listing externally-supplied controlled vocabularies. | The catalog file can be in NewsML 1.

sportsTitle.description: A short textual description of the document. | Can show up in search results.

advisory.description: A short textual message to editors receiving the document. | Not generally published through to end-users.

featureName.description: A displayable name for the resource identified by the fixture-key.

docId.description: The often-unique ID of the document, tracked by publishers.

dateTime.description: Date-timestamp for the document, normalized to ISO 8601 extended format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM. Use YYYY-MM-DD when no time is available

language.description: The default language of the document. NAR-construction. Values must be valid BCP 47 language tags.

slug.description: A keyword used by editors to refer to the document.

documentClass.description: A category code for the fixture-key. Recommended categories are news (non-event-specific news reports for player, team, league, etc.), standings (or tables), schedules, statistics (for non-event-specific statistical reports), event-summary (for event-specific reports whether prose (i.e. previews and reviews) or statistical (i.e. boxscores)), event-action (for play actions within a single event), dynamic-resource-file (for team rosters (squad lists), athlete lists, league groupings and teams, etc.)

fixtureKey.description: A consistent key for the type of regularly-published document being transmitted. External controlled vocabulary: fixture-key.list

sportsContentCodes.description: A container for content-codes. | Can hold as many codes as needed to describe all contents at this level and below.

sportsContentCode.description: An individual code that describes an entity one may want to filter for. Describes what sports, what teams, etc., are covered.

codeType.description: What type of item is being described.

codeKey.description: The symbol for the identified content. SportsML vocabulary uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spcode/

codeName.description: A displayable name for the code.

sportsContentQualifier.description: Further refinement/elaboration of a sports-content-code. | If the document covers more than one of these, additional sports-content-qualifier elements may be used.

participantCount.description: Number of participants playing on a team or side in the events covered. SportsML vocabulary uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spparticipantcount/

professionalStatus.description: The professional-status of the events covered. SportsML vocabulary uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spprofessionalstatus/

specialGroup.description: If the events covered are for special groups. Can be school-oriented, age-oriented, or group names, like Firefighters.

minimumAge.description: Lowest age for participants, in years. Examples: 0, 14, 21.5.

maximumAge.description: Highest age for participants, in years. Examples: 8, 65, 120.

sportsProperty.description: An extensible property, similar to structures in NewsML 1.

formalName.description: The code or key for the property.

vocabulary.description: Provides a pointer to a Topic Set which is the controlled vocabulary that can be used to resolve the meaning of the formal-name.

scheme.description: Distinguishes which of possibly multiple naming schemes in the controlled vocabulary is the one that governs this formal-name.

value.description: The value of the property. For example, if formal-name equals favorite-color, then value might equal blue.

allowedValues.description: Points to a controlled vocabulary that delimits the set of allowed values for the property.

sportsEvent.description: A sporting competition. | A contest that generally ends with a winner.

actions.description: Single element that can hold multiple action elements

sportsEvents.description: For sports-events that are subevents of another event.

eventSponsor.description: A sponsor for an event. | Events can have more than one sponsor.

highlight.description: A textual highlight. | Can hold plain text, or could hold NITF.

site.description: An element housing data having to do with a venue, stadium, arena, field, etc.

capacity.description: How many spectators can fill the site.

siteStyle.description: Whether it is an indoor or outdoor site.

surface.description: Describes the surface upon which events are played. For example, in tennis, could be hard-court or grass or clay.

shape.description: A controlled vocabulary for the site's shape. Example for motor-racing: oval.

incline.description: The pitch or embankment of the field of play. Generally in degrees. Example for motor-racing: 13.

length.description: The length of the arena or field of play.

lengthUnits.description: The units used for the length attribute.

type.description: A controlled vocabulary for the type or class of arena. Example for motor-racing: super-speedway.

homePageUrl.description: The website for the venue or arena.

created.description: Date (and time) when a place was built, opened or so.

ceasedToExist.description: Date (and time) when a place ceased to exist.

siteStats.description: Holder for statistics about the site.

alignment.description: Statistics about the site, accurate for a particular occasion. home means the site is home for one of the teams or players. neutral that it is neutral to all participants in the event.

attendance.description: How many spectators attended during the event.

attendanceAverage.description: Average number of spectators that have attended.

temperature.description: Temperature of the event recorded during the competition.

weatherCode.description: A controlled-vocabulary description of the weather, such as sunny, partly-cloudy, etc.

weatherWind.description: Wind reading of the event recorded during the competition.

weatherPrediction.description: Predicted weather conditions for the event.

team.description: A team participating in a sporting event. | Holds metadata and statistical data for team.

subScore.description: Statistics that detail the score for a particular period or inning. Per-sport controlled vocabularies used for period- value.

periodValue.description: Generally a natural number. Could also be quarter-1, period-2, inning-5, etc.

score.description: The score for that period (or scoring unit).

subScoreKey.description: The symbol for the sub-score unit.

subScoreName.description: The name of the sub-score unit.

rank.description: The ranking result of the sub-score unit.

totalScore.description: The running total during the sub-score period or unit. Good for split scores.

scoreAttempts.description: The attempts to score during the period (or scoring unit).

penaltyStats.description: Statistics that detail the number of each type of penalty. | Can be recorded for either a team or a player.

type.description: Could be a numeric value like 2, 5 or 10 for ice hockey, or yellow-card or red-card for soccer etc.

count.description: The number of that type of penalities for this team or player.

value.description: Amount penalized. Eg. total minutes (ice-hockey, lacrosse, etc.) or yards (american-football).

outcomeTotal.description: A report on the number of wins, losses, etc., the team or player had during a particular time period. | Can also be scoped with various coverage qualifications, such as just events played at home.

undecideds.description: Number of events that were started, but ended up undecided.

winningPercentage.description: The winning percentage. Generally, wins divided by total events completed.

pointsScoredFor.description: The number of points a team has scored against its opponents during an extended time period.

pointsScoredAgainst.description: The number of points scored against a team by its opponents during an extended time period.

pointsDifference.description: The final calculated difference between points-scored-for and points-scored-against. Possibly takes into account other scoring aspects, such as penalties and differences in score-values.

standingPoints.description: A quantity used to rank teams, usually within a division, in order to decide who comes in first at the end of a season. Localized to the coverage-attributes.

standingPointsAgainst.description: Points counted against a team in rankings. Used in European handball standings, for example.

streakType.description: Whether this is a streak of wins, of losses, etc. SportsML vocabulary uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spstreaktype/

streakTotal.description: Holds the number of goals scored during a streak-type of score, for example.

streakStart.description: Date on which the streak began.

streakEnd.description: Date on which the streak ended.

eventsPlayed.description: Number of events played within the scope of play.

eventsRemaining.description: Number of events remaining within the scope of play.

gamesBack.description: A number used to measure how behind one team is from first place. The first place team is 0 games back.

lossesOvertime.description: Number of losses in events which went into overtime. For leagues that use this as a top-level outcome category (eg. NHL), as opposed to just a derivative of scoping.

outcomeResult.description: A report on the result, if any, from the event etc.

type.description: The type of outcome result. Can be things like relegation, promotion and qualification

key.description: A key for the type of result described

comment.description: Textual comment about the outcome result

award.description: A medal, ribbon, placement, or other type of award. | Can be assigned to an event, a team, or a player.

playerOrTeamIdref.description: Reference to the player or team that received the award.

total.description: Total number of these such awards given to the player or team. Can be used to count medals for each country.

place.description: The place for which this prize is offered. For example, place='1' means the first-place prize.

value.description: The amount of money earned by the player who came in this place.

currency.description: The units of currency for the value attribute.

eventRecord.description: A world, national, state, or school record. | More than one record can be set by one participant at one sports-event.

previousRecord.description: The score value of the previously-held record.

rank.description: How a team is doing in comparison to other teams or players. | May be qualified, so that one ranks teams or players according to, say, how they play at home, or within their division.

type.description: The type of the rank. Generally a publisher-specific controlled vocabulary.

issuer.description: The entity or organization which issued the rank.

rating.description: A judged value placed on the team or individual. | Often used in British soccer.

ratingIssuer.description: The entity or organization which issued the rating.

ratingMaximum.description: The maximum value for the rating.

player.description: A competitor. | Their athletic talents help them decide who wins a sports-event.

officials.description: A set of officials. | May hold zero or more.

official.description: Also referred to as umpire or referree. | Ensures that the sports-event is played according to its rules.

associate.description: Manager or coach or jockey, etc. | An individual or a group that assists a team or player, and functions in a supporting capacity.

affiliation.description: A mechanism for assigning the membership of a player, team, or associate within a division or larger organizational structure. Also, to indicate an official's affiliation with a team, club or federation, for example.

membershipIdref.description: A pointer to the ID for the larger organizational structure.

membershipType.description: The type of organizational structure in which this item is a member.

membershipKey.description: A unique key for the organizational structure in which this item is a member.

membershipName.description: The name associated with the organizational structure in which this item is a member.

tournament.description: A structured series of competitions within one sport. | Generally organized by a particular sponsoring body. Can happen all in one day, or be spread out - like the Davis Cup in tennis.

tournamentDivision.description: A tournament subcategory, often with its own trophy and prize. | Use it to divide specific overall competitions in a large multi-sport tournament such as Olympics. Can also divide gender competitions, for example in tennis tournaments. Can be nested to divide gender at a higher level (tournament/tournament-division) and then to divide specific sport competitions futher down the tree (tournament-part/tournament-division).

tournamentPart.description: A tournament part. Use it do group specific parts of a tournament, like a stage or a round.

partIndex.description: For provider-specific tournament indexing systems. DPA, for example, has one that looks like this: part-name='Group A' part-index='p1/1/p2/A'

article.description: Holds either an article or a reference to an article. | Recommended format is NITF.

articleRef.description: URL or system identifier (or IDREF?) to an externally-located news article.

standing.description: Also known as a (league) table | A ranked, comparative list of team or individual records.

contentLabel.description: A displayable label describing this standing.

standingMetadata.description: A series of team or individual records. | A series of team or individual records.

schedule.description: A series of games. | Usually grouped by date.

dateLabel.description: Displayable label that describes what dates this schedule covers.

contentLabel.description: Displayable label that describes what events this schedule includes.

scheduleMetadata.description: Background information about the schedule. | Describes the time period which the schedule covers, and which teams or events may be covered.

statistic.description: A table that generally compares the performance of teams or players. | The fixture-key can identify which regulary-running statistics are being presented. Also appropriate for rosters (squad listings).

type.description: A code describing the class of statistic covered herein, generally part of a controlled vocabulary.

contentLabel.description: A display label for the enclosed statistical ranking. (Should be placed as name in the metadata section.)

statisticMetadata.description: Identifies which teams are being covered. | Also indicates the date ranges for which these stats cover.

statusChange.description: Indicates status change of an entity.

changerIdref.description: A pointer to the player or team that has undergone the status change.

statusChangeType.description: What type of change was made in the status of a player or team. Examples are injury, trade, cut.

originalStatus.description: What the original status of the player or team was. Examples are active, inactive, disabled-list.

newStatus.description: What the new status of the player or team is. Examples are active, inactive, disabled-list.

originalIdref.description: Generally, a pointer to the original team that the player in changer-idref was affiliated with.

newIdref.description: Generally, a pointer to the new team that the player in changer-idref is now affiliated with.

group.description: A holder for statistics about a particular bracket or division or conference or league. | Holds metadata and stats. Also appropriate for expressing general organization/league membership and structure.

groupType.description: The type of group. For example: conference, division, etc.

homePageUrl.description: The home page URL for the group.

groupStats.description: Statistics that apply to the group as a whole. | Not all stats are used in every sport.

genericStat.description: A generic stat element that can be used together with or instead of more specific stat element and attributes. With nested stats the lower levels should be regarded as having the same value as their parents if that attribute is not specifically set.

name.description: The name of the stat. SportsML names are same as attribute names of stats in the sport-specific plugins.

wageringStats.description: An element to house lines and odds for wagering. | Includes moneylines, spreads, etc.

comment.description: A generic comment for the wagering stats.

wageringMoneyline.description: Odds in terms of money. | Negative amount indicates wagerer must lay that amount to win say a hundred dollars. Positive amount indicates wagerer gets that amount for every hundred dollars wagered.

valueOpening.description: The opening value for this runline.

wageringStraightSpread.description: A wager built around the different between the scores of two teams.

value.description: The number of points for which the two scores should differ.

wageringTotalScore.description: Total combined point/runs/goals scored in a game.

lineOver.description: The OVER section of an over/under line.

lineUnder.description: The UNDER section of an over/under line.

total.description: The combined total of the score for the two teams.

lineOverOpening.description: The opening value of the OVER section of an over/under line.

lineUnderOpening.description: The opening value of the UNDER section of an over/under line.

totalOpening.description: The opening value of the combined score for the two teams.

wageringOdds.description: A line that gives formal odds on a team or player winning, such as 3-to-1 odds.

numerator.description: The numerator of the chances this team or player is given.

denominator.description: The denominator of the chances this team or player is given.

numeratorOpening.description: The opening value of the numerator.

denominatorOpening.description: The opening value of the denominator.

payoutCalcluation.description: How much money additional gets paid should this team or player or team win.

paybackAmount.description: The total amount paid back to the winning wagerer, including the amount invested.

wageringPrediction.description: A prediction as to whether a team or player is a favorite or an underdog.

prediction.description: Whether this team or player is the favorite or the underdog.

baseMetadata.description: Basic metadata elements and attributes. Used directly by sports, standing, schedule and statistic and extended further by base2Metadata

base2Metadata.description: Extends the baseMetadata with more elements and attributes. Used by baseEvent and baseTournament

key.description: The symbol or identifying key for the tournament or tournament part.

baseStats.description: The very basic stats type for persons and teams, Extended by base2stats and used directly by officalstats.

base2Stats.description: Second level stats. Extends baseStats. Extended further in base3stats and used directly in associate

points.description: Points accumulated by this associate. For example, points earned by a NASCAR owner.

base3Stats.description: Extends base2stats. Further extended in genericEntitystats. Used directly by groupStats

baseGenericEntityStats.description: Statistics that apply to a team as a whole or a player. | Not all stats are used in every sport.

eventsPlayed.description: The number of sports-events in which this team or player has already participated.

timePlayedTotal.description: Value for the amount of time played by the team or player over the course of a particular time-span, such as a season.

baseTeamStats.description: Statistics that apply to the team as a whole. | Not all stats are used in every sport.

baseTeamMetadata.description: Info about the team. Properties of a team that are not based on their competitive performance. | An included sports-content-code element can hold what division it is in, etc.

alignment.description: Home or visiting. This is more information about the alignment of the team or player in the event regarding rules etc. It does not necessarily indicate that it is the geographical home-site of the team or player.

established.description: Date (and time) when the team was established.

dissolved.description: Date (and time) when the team was dissolved.

teamIdref.description: Optional reference to a team in which this team is a member. Example: The U.S. Davis Cup team consists of many sub-teams.

homePageUrl.description: The fully-qualified URL for the official home page of the team.

roundPosition.description: The seed or position in this particular round for which this team started. Useful for bracketed tournaments, such as tennis.

basePlayerStats.description: Statistics that capture how a player has performed. | Generally does change over the course of a sports-event.

timePlayedEvent.description: Value for the amount of time played by this player in a particular sports-event.

timePlayedEventAverage.description: Value for the average amount of time played per-event by the player over the course of a particular time-span, such as a season.

eventsStarted.description: Number of sports-events the player has played in since the start of the event.

dateTimeEntered.description: Exact universal time player entered event. For example, the time a downhill skiier began a run.

dateTimeExited.description: Exact universal time player exited event. For example, the time a downhill skiier finished a run.

eventTimeEntered.description: Time player entered event expressed as conventional game-clock time. For example, the game minute a soccer player was subbed on to the field.

eventTimeExited.description: Time player exited event expressed as conventional game-clock time. For example, the game minute a soccer player was subbed off the field.

action.description: Any number of action inside the actions holder.

teamIdref.description: This is considered the 'current' team in action

opposingTeamIdref.description: This is the opposing team, if any

created.description: Date and time when this play/action record was created. This would be the record from the reporter's data entry system.

lastModified.description: Date and time when this play/action record was last modified. This would be the record from the reporter's data entry system.

dateTime.description: Date and time when this play/action took place on the field.

result.description: The result of the play or action. See 'result' SportsML vocabs for various sports: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spamfresult/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spsocresult/

sequenceNumber.description: Sequence-number. Should be separate sequences for sub-actions inside an action

type.description: The type of competitive action taken on the field of play. See 'action' SportsML vocabs for various sports: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spamfaction/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spbblaction/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spbkbaction/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spichaction/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spmcraction/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/rgxaction/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spsocaction/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/sptenaction/

playerCount.description: Number of players in the 'current' team

playerCountOpposing.description: Number of players in the opposing team

startLocation.description: A string indicating where on the court the action began. Could be an approximate region, or a more complex value adhering to some elaborate coordinate system.

endLocation.description: A string indicating where on the court the action occured. Could be an approximate region, or a more complex value adhering to some elaborate coordinate system.

zone.description: The zone on the playing field where the action took place. qcoded value that can be sport specific

powerPlayAdvantage.description: Number of players more on the team in power play, also see the player count attributes

callerType.description: Who called the timeout, either team or official. ID is given under participant. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spamfcaller/

strength.description: Even strength, power play, short handed, etc. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spichstrength/

points.description: How many points this score was worth for the scoring team.

turnoverType.description: How the initiative changed. Steal, lost-ball etc.

periodValue.description: Number or name of current period of event. Normally a number but can be things like OT etc

periodLength.description: Length of current period of event

timeoutType.description: Type of timeout. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spamftimeout/

scoreType.description: The type of score for sports with more than one way to gain points (american-football) in which every play is a score attempt. For other sports use score-attempt-type. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spamfscore/

shotType.description: The type of shot taken. See 'shot' SportsML vocabs for various sports: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spgolshot/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/sptenshot/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spcurshot/

penaltyType.description: The name of the type of penalty. See 'penalty' SportsML vocabs for various sports: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spamfpenalty/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spichpenalty/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/sprgxpenalty/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spsocpenalty/

penaltyLevel.description: The degree of punishment for the penalty eg. yellow or red card, major, minor, game misconduct, etc. See 'penaltylevel' SportsML vocabs for various sports: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spbkbpenaltylevel/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spichpenaltylevel/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/sprgxpenaltylevel/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spsocpenaltylevel/

penaltyResult.description: What the foul resulted in. See 'penaltyresult' SportsML vocabs for various sports: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/sprgxpenaltyresult/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spsocpenaltyresult/

penaltySide.description: Which side committed the penalty, usually offense or defense. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/sppenaltyside/

penaltyLength.description: The length of this penalty. Normally in minutes, but could be rest of the game etc

penaltyCount.description: The sum of penalties recieved by this team/participant this event

penaltyStatus.description: If this action marks the start or the end of the penalty time.

recipientType.description: Whether the receiver of the penalty was the team, the player, a coach, a ref, etc. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/sprecipienttype/

scoreAttemptType.description: The type of score that was attempted. See 'scoreattempt' SportsML vocabs for various sports: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spbkbscoreattempt/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spichscoreattempt/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/sprgxscoreattempt/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spsocscoreattempt/

scoreAttemptResult.description: The result of the score attempt eg. blocked, missed, etc. See 'scoreattemptresult' SportsML vocabs for various sports: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spbkbscoreattemptresult/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spichscoreattemtresult/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/sprgxscoreattemptresult/ http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spsocscoreattemptresult/

scoreAttemptSide.description: Side of the body of the player attempting to score

scoreAttemptMethod.description: What part of the body or equipment the player used to attempt to score. See 'scoreattemptmethod' SportsML vocabs for various sports: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spsocscoreattemptmethod/

goalZone.description: Part of the goal where the score or score-attempt was aimed.

angle.description: Angle on the field of the play.

distance.description: Angle on the field of the play.

bodyPart.description: Body part used to perform an action.

fieldLocation.description: Recommended x,y 0-100. The location of the action on the field of play represented as a grid.

goalLocation.description: Recommended x,y 0-100. The location on goal-mouth grid in which the ball/puck entered.

shootoutShotOrder.description: When this shot was take, amongst all the shootout shots of a game for one particular team. For example: 3 (if it was the third shot of the shootout).

faceoffWinner.description: also used to show winner of jumpball in basket.

participant.description: Used for human participants, animals, equipment whatever.

goalsCumulative.description: Total number goals at time of goal scored.

assistsCumulative.description: Total number assists at time of assist scored.

scoreCredit.description: Whether the participant in the play can be given credit for the goal or score.

idref.description: A pointer to a player who participated in the play.

teamIdref.description: A pointer to the participant's team.

role.description: The role of the participant in the particular action, as opposed to their designated position on the team.

baseEventMetadata.description: Background information about an event. | Where, when, and what an event is.

eventRecurringName.description: A displayable name for the event-recurring-key.

eventRecurringKey.description: The symbol for an identified sports-event that recurs every season. This same key should be used from season to season.

eventStyle.description: Indicates whether competitors are trying to defeat each other or just outdo one another. SportsML vocabulary uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/speventstyle/

eventNumber.description: The ranked position this event had among other events.

eventType.description: The type of event, esp. in relation to tournament phase. Recommended SportsML vocabulary uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/sptournamentphase/

eventStatus.description: The stage of the event, describing whether it has started, is in progress, etc.

eventStatusReason.description: The reason for the event status. Eg. why the cancellation, postponement, etc. CHECK!!

eventStatusNote.description: A textual description of the reason or context of the event-status or event-status-reason value.

eventOfDay.description: If the day had multiple events involving these competitors, which event of the day it was. Example values: 1, 2, 3, etc.

eventsDayTotal.description: How many events involving these competitors have been planned for that day.

startWeekday.description: Day of the week in which the game starts.

endWeekday.description: Day of the week in which the game ends.

heatNumber.description: The ranked position this heat had among other heats.

duration.description: The length of time the event took place.

seasonKey.description: The season this event is in.

seriesIndex.description: The tournament division or series to which an event belongs.

eventOutcomeType.description: What type of outcome. Includes overtime, random (eg. by coin toss), etc. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/speventoutcometype/

baseEntityMetadata.description: Base metadata for different entities. Extended by baseTeamMetadata and basePersonMetadata and siteMetadata

key.description: The symbol or identifying key for the entity.

nationality.description: The country of citizinship of the entity.

basePersonMetadata.description: Metadata that describes a person. | Generally does not change over the course of a sports-events. Extends the baseEntityMetadata type

dateOfBirth.description: The day on which a person was born, normalized to ISO 8601 extended format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM. Use YYYY-MM-DD when no time is available. Can also be YYYY-MM or just YYYY if year and/or month not available.

dateOfDeath.description: The day on which a person died, normalized to ISO 8601 extended format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM. Use YYYY-MM-DD when no time is available.

height.description: Height of the person. Generally in cm.

weight.description: Weight of a person. Generally in kg.

positionRegular.description: The code for the typical position of the person.

positionEvent.description: The code for the position held by the person at this particular sports-event.

positionDepth.description: A ranking amongst players on the team who share the same position.

health.description: An indication of the health of the person.

basePlayerMetadata.description: Metadata that describes a person. | Generally does not change over the course of a sports-events.

teamIdref.description: A reference to the team for which this player competes.

status.description: Whether a player starts playing at the beginning of a sports-event, joins mid-game, or is not available to participate.

lineupSlot.description: The order in which a player participated in an event.

lineupSlotSequence.description: For baseball, cricket, relay races if they substituted for a player in the original lineup, the order in which they served at the above lineup-slot value. Defaults to 1.

scratchReason.description: An indication as to why this player did not play in an event.

uniformNumber.description: The number currently displayed on the uniform or jersey of the player.

homePageUrl.description: The fully-qualified URL for the official home page of the team.

roundPosition.description: The seed or position in this particular round for which this player started. Useful for bracketed tournaments, such as tennis.

baseCareerPhaseMetadata.description: A description of where a player is playing, or has previously played. | Can be used to state where the player went to college. Can also list previous teams of the player.

phaseType.description: Value can be college or professional, etc.

startDate.description: When the player started this phase in the career, normalized to ISO 8601 extended format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM. Use YYYY-MM-DD when no time is available.

endDate.description: When the player ended this phase in the career, normalized to ISO 8601 extended format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM. Use YYYY-MM-DD when no time is available.

duration.description: In lieu of a start-date and end-date. Generally in years. Could hold the number of years that a player was a pro. Use temporal-unit vocabulary.

subphaseType.description: A subcategory of the phase-type, for example could be sophomore or rookie.

phaseStatus.description: Player's status within a particular phase. For example, active, injured, etc.

phaseCaliber.description: A controlled vocabulary for the name attribute. States organization this player was in, for the duration of the phase. For example, league or team.

phaseCaliberKey.description: The metadata key within the phase-caliber. For example, l.nfl.com if phase-caliber is league. Or l.nfl.com-t.2 if phase-caliber is team.

entryReason.description: The reason why the player entered this phase. For example, draft or trade.

selectionLevel.description: The level within which the player was selected to enter this phase. For example, 1, if drafted in 1st round.

selectionSublevel.description: The sublevel of the selection-level. For example, 27, if picked as 27th selection in 1st round.

selectionOverall.description: The total ranking amongst all levels in a draft.

exitReason.description: The reason why the player exitted this phase. For example, retired or waived.

baseInjuryPhaseMetadata.description: A description of where a player is playing, or has previously played. | Can be used to state where the player went to college. Can also list previous teams of the player.

phaseType.description: Value can be college or professional, etc.

startDate.description: When the player started this phase in the career, normalized to ISO 8601 extended format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM. Use YYYY-MM-DD when no time is available.

endDate.description: When the player ended this phase in the career, normalized to ISO 8601 extended format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM. Use YYYY-MM-DD when no time is available.

phaseStatus.description: Player's status within a particular phase. For example, active, injured, etc.

injuryType.description: A controlled vocabulary for the injury. For example, thigh or hand or lower-back.

injurySide.description: A controlled vocabulary for the body side of the injury. For example, left or right.

upcomingEventDate.description: Generally, the date on which this player has a non-injured status, and has some probability of playing again.

upcomingEventKey.description: The key for the forthcoming event taking place on upcoming-event-date.

upcomingEventStatus.description: A measurement of the status of the player for that upcoming event. For example, probable or likely.

comment.description: A textual description for the injury phase.

baseOfficialMetadata.description: Metadata about the official. | Generally does not change over the course of a sports-events.

uniformNumber.description: The number currently displayed on the uniform or jersey of the official.

baseAssociateMetadata.description: Metadata that describes an associate | Generally does not change over the course of a sports-events.

baseTournamentMetadata.description: Background data about a tournament or tournament part. | Where and when the this tournament took place.

baseTimeAdjustment.description: Record time added by referee. | Holds values for the time added by the referee and how much extra time was actually played.

periodExtraTimeAdded.description: How many minutes the referee has decided to add to the period.

periodExtraTimeElapsed.description: How much time exactly MMSS that was actually elapsed in the period.

statsCoverage.description: A relative indication of how many statistics are included in the item. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spstatscoverage/

teamCoverage.description: Indicates whether the item contains information about one team, or many teams.

durationScope.description: Indicates what class of events the included statistics apply. Example: those events that went into overtime. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spdurationscope/

alignmentScope.description: Indicates that the included statistics apply only to events played either at home or away.

position.description: Indicates that the included statistics apply only to while played at a particular position.

recordMakingScope.description: Indicates that the included statistics apply only to values that set a record, such as a team-high, or an individual-low.

scopingLabel.description: A textual description for the scope.

periodValue.description: Used for tracking stats and events by period.

periodType.description: For certain types of periods: overtime, declared (cricket), etc.

startDateTime.description: The starting date, with optional time, of the event for which the stats are relevant.

endDateTime.description: The ending date, with optional time, of the event for which the stats are relevant.

periodStartDateTime.description: The starting date, with optional time, of the period for which the stats are relevant.

periodEndDateTime.description: The ending date, with optional time, of the period for which the stats are relevant.

temporalUnitType.description: The unit of performance to which the stats apply eg. single-event, season, career.

temporalUnitValue.description: The key of performance unit to which the stats apply.

eventSpan.description: Qualifier of 'most-recent-events' value for temporal-unit attribute. Specify the number of events eg. 10 for last 10 games.

opponentValue.description: The key of the player, team, division, conference, league or other unit which provide the opposition relevant to the stat.

opponentType.description: Whether the opponent was a player, team, etc.

team.description: The key of the team for which the player or team generated the stats.

competition.description: The key of the league or competition for which the player or team generated the stats.

unitValue.description: The key, other than team or league/competition, of the competitive unit for which the player or team generated the stats.

unitType.description: The type, other than team or league/competition, of the competitive unit for which the player or team generated the stats.

situation.description: Final or current score of the team or player.

locationKey.description: The key of the site,venue or location where the stats were generated.

venueType.description: The type of event (eg. indoor, outdoor, etc.) in which the stats were generated.

surfaceType.description: The type of surface (eg. clay, artificial grass, etc.) upon which the stats were generated.

weatherType.description: A code for the weather situation in which the stats were generated. SportsML weather codes recommended.

scopeValue.description: A generic scope indicator. Use only if none of the other coverage attributes are suitable.

distance.description: Measure of distance for the generated stat.

distanceMaximum.description: Maximum distance for the generated stat.

distanceMinimum.description: Minimum distance for the generated stat.

score.description: Final or current score of the team or player.

scoreOpposing.description: Final or current score of the opposing team or player.

scoreAverage.description: Average per-game score for the team or player.

scoreOpposingAverage.description: Average per-game score for the opposing team or player.

scoreUnits.description: Describes how the score and score-opposing is valued.

scoreBehind.description: The points or time behind the leading score.

scoreAttempts.description: Final or current number of attempts to score by a team or player. Example: in ice hockey, would represent total shots on goal.

scoreAttemptsOpposing.description: Final or current number of attempts to score by an opposing team or player.

scoreAttemptsOnGoal.description: A subset of score-attempts. Only counts those attempts that were on-goal.

scoreAttemptsOnGoalOpposing.description: Final or current number of attempts to score by an opposing team or player that were on-goal.

scorePercentage.description: Percentage of attempted scores that reached their mark.

scorePercentageOpposing.description: Percentage of attempted scores by opposing team or player that reached their mark.

resultEffect.description: Describes the effect that the result of the event or rank changing has had on the team. Example: Whether or not a team has qualified for the playoffs, or has been promoted or demoted to a different division.

eventOutcome.description: Whether the competitor won, lost, or tied. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/speventoutcome/

eventStandingPoints.description: How many points were earned as a result of the outcome of this particular event.

eventStandingPointsAgainst.description: How many points were deducted as a result of the outcome of this particular event. This occurs, for example, in the German Handball leagues.

eventsRemaining.description: Number of sports-events the player has yet to participate in.

timeOfPossession.description: Amount of time the team or player has possession of ball (or similar object like puck).

timeOfPossessionPercentage.description: Amount of time the team or player has possession of ball (or similar object like puck) expressed as a percentage of the full time of the match.

timeOfPossessionPercentageOpposing.description: Amount of time the opposing team or player has possession of ball (or similar object like puck) expressed as a percentage of the full time of the match.

timeOfPossessionAverage.description: Amount of time the team or player has possession of ball (or similar object like puck) per game.

timeOfPossessionAverageOpposing.description: Amount of time the opposing team or player has possession of ball (or similar object like puck) per game.

seriesScore.description: Number of events in a series won by team or player.

seriesScoreOpposing.description: Number of events in a series won by opposing team or player.

adjustedScoreFor.description: The final score as adjusted by some authority. Usually as a result of some dispute or transgression that must be settled post-event and rendered in the score. Will differ from the regular score reflecting the number of actual goals scored in play. Should be tested for before displaying actual score.

adjustedScoreAgainst.description: The final score against as adjusted by some authority. Usually as a result of some dispute or transgression that must be settled post-event and rendered in the score. Will differ from the regular score reflecting the number of actual goals scored in play. Should be tested for before displaying actual score.

distanceFor1stDown.description: The distance between the current line of scrimmage and the line to gain, 10 yards downfield from the start of possession. In yards. The word goal is used when the distance to the goal line is less than 10 yards. The word kick is used for kick-scoring attempt.

fieldSide.description: Which side of the field the event is taking place. Either 'home' or 'away'.

fieldLine.description: The line of scrimmage. The yard line where the ball is placed at the start of play.

drivePlays.description: The number of plays in this drive.

driveYards.description: The number of yards covered during this drive.

driveDuration.description: The time it took for the drive.

driveResult.description: How a drive came to an end. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spamfdriveresult/

down.description: The current down. Valid values are 1,2,3,4,5. (Could period be used?)

outType.description: How the batter got out. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spbblout/

trajectoryCoordinates.description: The path of the ball. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spbbltrajectory/

ballLocationHorizontal.description: Where the pitch was located horizontally. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spbblballlocationhorizontal/

ballLocationVertical.description: Where the pitch was located vertically. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spbblballlocationvertical/

umpireCall.description: The net result of the pitch.

endNumber.description: A curling game normally have 10 ends, but it can also be 8 or even 6

stoneNumber.description: Each end has 8 stones per team

timeUsed.description: How much time the team used for this play

round.description: Which round this play takes place in

hole.description: Which hole this play takes place on

strokes.description: How many strokes this player has done so far

score.description: The current score of this player

scoreAgainstPar.description: How the score of this player is compared to the course par

startDistance.description: The distance from the cup where the stroke was taken

endDistance.description: The distance from the cup where the ball stopped after the stroke

landing.description: The place or surface where a golf ball lands after being shot. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spgollanding/

lap.description: Which lap number this play takes place in

lapsRemaining.description: How many laps are remaining when this play takes place

flagState.description: Types of motor racing communication flags. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spmcrflag/

flagOriginal.description: Types of motor racing communication flags. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spmcrflag/

flagNew.description: Types of motor racing communication flags. SportsML vocab uri: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/spmcrflag/

set.description: Which set this play takes place in. Tennis is played in 3 or 5 sets

game.description: Which game in this set the play takes place in

tournamentAttributes.description: Attributes that are used in all tournament constructions.

status.description: The state of the tournament or tournament part, describing whether it has started, is in progress, etc.

minimumSubparts.description: The minimum number of subparts for this level in a tournament. The subparts can either be tournament-part or sports-event.

maximumSubparts.description: The maximum number of subparts for this level in a tournament. The subparts can either be tournament-part or sports-event.

number.description: The number of the particular tournament part eg. 2 for second round or second leg

id.description: An XML-specific identifier for the element.

style.description: An open placeholder for reference by an external stylesheet.

genericStatAttributes.description: List of attributes used in generic stats

sport.description: The sport to which the stats belong.

class.description: The general classification of the stat within the sport eg ofensive, defensive, rebounding (basketball), special teams (american football).

statType.description: The formal identifier of the kind of stat.

valueType.description: The formal type of the stat value eg. integer, string, etc.

wageringAttributes.description: Basic wagering attributes, used in all wagering elements

bookmakerKey.description: Unique ID for the make of the line.

bookmakerName.description: Name of the maker of the line.

rotationKey.description: Reusable ID for the team generally agreed upon by a pool of bookmakers.

comment.description: A comment for this line. Often the same comment is supplied for both teams in a game.

dateTime.description: The date and time which this wagering info was assigned by the bookmaker, normalized to ISO 8601 extended format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS+HH:MM. Use YYYY-MM-DD when no time is available.

context.description: An indication of whether this line is a current line, or a repeat of a special-interest line from the past.

prediction.description: Whether this team or player is the favorite or the underdog.

predictionOpening.description: The opening value for this prediction.

vigorish.description: The commission paid to the bookmaker.

lineOpening.description: The opening line for this runline.

minutesElapsed.description: Number of minutes that have elapsed since the beginning of the game.

periodMinuteElapsed.description: The time elapsed, but only given as whole minutes.

periodTimeElapsed.description: The time elapsed in the current period.

periodTimeRemaining.description: The time remaining in the current period.
